Description: Irregular strip of linen medium-coarse quality cloth, possibly coloured with yellow pigment. Rather loose weave with a high proportion of warp to weft threads. Edges torn or ragged. The weave is plain [warp-faced simple tabby] and the threads are S-spun and S-spliced; the stitch gauge is warp c.23 ends per 10mm and weft c.7 picks per 10mm.
Curator's comments: It is possible that BM 6560, 6558, 6559b, 6556 and this textile, are all the same textile. Information from Hero Granger-Taylor [1993]
